definition: not knowing what to do (idiom); at one's wits' end/embarrassed and at a complete loss
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
to handle/to manage/to put in order/to arrange/to administer/to execute/to take action on/to plan

sentences.english: He did a backspin serve, Denton didn't know how to do it.
sentences.chinese: 他发了个下旋球，搞得丹顿不知所措。

sentences.english: Hearing what Xu You said, he suddenly felt embarrassed and at a loss.
sentences.chinese: 意而子听许由这么说，顿时觉得尴尬而不知所措。

sentences.english: "What is Hollywood culture?" Wen Xianglin saw Wen Xiang had become righteously indignant , and this so alarmed her that she was unsure what to do.
sentences.chinese: 文湘琳见文祥慷慨激昂的样子，吓得有点不知所措。

sentences.english: Ronald confused Denton again with his serve.
sentences.chinese: 罗纳德的发球又一次使丹顿不知所措。

sentences.english: I used a few tactics to keep my competition in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 我略施小计，使竞争对手不知所措。

sentences.english: Suddenly, loses inspiration, makes me flurried and be at loss.
sentences.chinese: 顿时失去了灵感，慌张而不知所措。

sentences.english: Small problems will seem large and it would be easy to feel overwhelmed or overtired.
sentences.chinese: 小问题会显得大，很容易感到不知所措或过度疲劳。

sentences.english: The family, standing around, seemed unsure of what to do.
sentences.chinese: 站在他周围的家人们显得有点不知所措。

sentences.english: I was quite touched by this, though Charlotte was a bit perplexed.
sentences.chinese: 我很是感动，虽然夏洛特为此有点不知所措。

sentences.english: They fired off so many questions at him that he hardly knew what to do.
sentences.chinese: 他们连珠炮似地问了他许多问题，弄得他不知所措。

sentences.english: Eg: Big city's traffic bewilders me.
sentences.chinese: 大城市的交通使我不知所措。

sentences.english: Liu was all at sea when he began his new job.
sentences.chinese: 刘开始新工作的时候，茫然不知所措。

sentences.english: He was so embarrassed by the question, he tittered .
sentences.chinese: 他被问得不知所措地傻笑著。

sentences.english: Do you ever feel overwhelmed or have too much to do?
sentences.chinese: 你是否感到不知所措或是工作太多无从下手？

sentences.english: I was initially lost in translation and disorientated.
sentences.chinese: 起初，我对于翻译不知所措。

sentences.english: He is in from height merely ice bewail, be at a loss unexpectedly rise.
sentences.chinese: 他只顾自个儿在冰上叹惜，竟不知所措起来。

definition: at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
to not know the reason/to not know what to do
not knowing which course to follow (idiom); at a loss what to do
to feel dizzy/to be confused/to be at a loss/to stare blankly/Taiwan pr. [fa1 meng2]
